intro: Pouzolzia rheedii, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant is typically shrub-like, often growing in rocky or mountainous habitats. It has a short flowering period, usually in the spring, and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions. Pouzolzia rheedii is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
